title: ’’No beds, no rights’’: UK woman held over £1.2m Kush haul cries foul in Sri Lanka jail
byline: Sri Lanka’s Prisons Department yesterday has denied claims of mistreatment made by a British woman who was remanded on drug charges, insisting she is being treated in accordance with prison regulations and is not entitled to any special privileges.

title: Labour Department to probe NEXT Manufacturing closure amid worker rights concerns
byline: The closure of operation by NEXT Manufacturing, a factory owned by UK group, in the Katunayake industrial zone over high operating costs, will come under probe by the Labour Department over possible violations of the law related to workers’ rights, a Minister said yesterday.

title: CB cuts rates to pre-empt any fallout from trade uncertainty
byline: The Central Bank delivered a surprise rate cut yesterday at its third monetary policy meeting for the year, reducing its key policy rate, the Overnight Policy Rate (OPR), by 25 basis points to 7.75 percent.

title: Trump administration bars Harvard from enrolling international students
byline: The Trump administration on Thursday revoked Harvard University’s ability to enroll international students, delivering a sharp punishment to the elite institution for refusing to bow to the administration’s policy demands.

title: Committee appointed to probe complaints against Dayasiri
byline: Speaker Jagath Wickramaratne today announced that he had appointed a three-member committee to look into complaints received against Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MP Dayasiri Jayasekara.

title: Anudi advances to Miss World 2025 Head-to-Head challenge
byline: Anudi Gunasekara has advanced into the Top 5 from Asia in the Head-to-Head Challenge at the 72nd Miss World pageant, marking a historic achievement as the first Sri Lankan to reach the finalist stage in this segment.

title: Is salt crisis worsening?
byline: Sri Lanka, an island nation surrounded by the Indian Ocean, is facing an unusual shortage of salt triggered by supply disruptions after heavy rainfall.

title: Language learning for school children to be made compulsory: PM
byline: The Government plans to make learning Tamil and Sinhalese students from Grade Six to Nine learn both Tamil and Sinhalese as their respective second languages, Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya told Parliament today.

title: Former Minister Duminda Dissanayake arrested
byline: Former Anuradhapura District MP Duminda Dissanayake has been arrested by the Terrorism Investigation Division this morning over the recovery of a gold-plated T56 weapon from the Havelock City housing complex in Colombo.

title: No plans to increase water tariff: Minister
byline: There are no plans to increase the water tariff, Minister of Urban Development and Construction Anura Karunathilaka told Parliament today.

title: Education Ministry to use blended learning as solution to teacher shortage: PM
byline: The Education Ministry is looking to adopt blended learning as an interim solution to the shortage of teachers, Education Minister and Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya said today.

title: Parliament renovations to be done by police, army
byline: The Parliamentary Staff Advisory Committee has approved the ongoing renovation works of the Parliament building to be carried out with the assistance of the Sri Lanka Army and the Sri Lanka Police.

title: NPP secretly approaching SLPP members to form councils
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) MP D.V. Chanaka said the National People’s Power (NPP) was secretly approaching members elected from the SLPP to seek their support to form councils.

title: Foreign cigarettes worth Rs. 3.54 million seized
byline: A consignment of foreign cigarettes valued at Rs. 3.54 million was seized and a Sri Lankan passenger who attempted to smuggle it into the country was arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) by the Airport Police in the early hours of this morning.

title: Angelo Mathews announces retirement from Test cricket
byline: Veteran Sri Lankan cricketer Angelo Mathews has announced his retirement from Test cricket. Mathews conveyed his decision through a post on his official handle on social media platform X (formerly Twitter).

title: Stop meal price hike for non-executive staff in Parliament: Sajith
byline: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa today urged the government to rethink about the meal price hike for non-executive staff in Parliament.

title: Ampitiye Sumanarathana Thera arrested
byline: The Chief Incumbent of the Sri Mangalarama Viharaya in Batticaloa, Ven. Ampitiye Sumanarathana Thera has been arrested by the Ampara Police.

title: Katunayake factory offers to find jobs for those affected due to factory closure: Deputy Minister
byline: The management of the Katunayake factory has assured to help find jobs for the employees who lost their jobs due to the factory closure, Deputy Minister of Labour Mahinda Jayasinghe said today.

title: Sri Lankan teen wins prestigious International public speaking competition
byline: Sixteen-year-old Sashane Dassanayake has brought global recognition to Sri Lanka by winning the 2025 International Public Speaking Competition, held at the English-Speaking Union (ESU) International Headquarters, Dartmouth House, London, from May 12 to 16.

title: Duminda Dissanayake arrested
byline: Former Anuradhapura District MP Duminda Dissanayake has been arrested by the Terrorism Investigation Division this morning over the recovery of a gold-plated T56 weapon from the Havelock City housing complex in Colombo.

title: Over 15 senior police officers transferred with immediate effect
byline: The National Police Commission has approved a series of immediate transfers and new appointments affecting 16 Officers-in-Charge (OICs) across various police stations and divisions in Sri Lanka.

title: DMT Deputy Commissioner among three arrested in Rs. 4 Mn bribery scandal
byline: The Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) has arrested three individuals, including a Deputy Commissioner of the Department of Motor Traffic for allegedly accepting a bribe of Rs. 4 million.

title: Is Health Ministry blocking salt imports?
byline: The Ministry of Health has firmly denied recent media reports suggesting that it is obstructing the importation of salt into Sri Lanka.

title: Deputy Labour Minister assures immediate action over ETF salary issues
byline: Labour Deputy Minister Mahinda Jayasinghe today assured swift action to resolve the salary-related grievances of employees at the Employees’ Trust Fund (ETF), following a heated protest and urgent discussions with trade union representatives.

title: Education Ministry revises school holidays for Hajj festival
byline: The Ministry of Education announced today that Muslim schools will be in session on May 26 and 27, 2025, due to a revision in the school holiday schedule for the Hajj festival (Eid al-Adha).

title: Closure of NEXT factory in Katunayake FTZ violates labour law, says Deputy Minister
byline: The sudden closure of the NEXT apparel manufacturing factory located in the Katunayake Free Trade Zone (FTZ) has drawn strong criticism from Deputy Minister of Labour Mahinda Jayasinghe, who said today that the move violates Sri Lanka’s labour laws due to the absence of prior notice.

title: Government firms up against genocide allegation: Foreign Minister
byline: Foreign Minister Vijitha Herath said the government will not hesitate to take legal action against individuals or groups who promote the idea that the Sri Lankan military committed genocide during the civil war.

title: Leave cricket before cricket leaves you!
byline: Former Sri Lanka Captain Angelo Mathews today announced his retirement from Test cricket. The veteran is set to play his last Test match against Bangladesh next month.

title: SC orders Rs. 1.2 Mn in personal compensation from policemen for torturing youth in custody
byline: In a landmark judgment, the Supreme Court today ordered six former police officers attached to the Thambuttegama Police Station to personally pay Rs. 1.2 million in compensation to a young man who was arbitrarily arrested and tortured in custody in 2012.

title: Sri Lankan delegation to engage in tariff talks in Washington
byline: A Sri Lankan delegation is set to participate in discussions in Washington, D.C., focusing on tariff-related matters, following an invitation extended by the Office of the United States Trade Representative (USTR).

title: CSE ends mixed as ASPI gains on continued rate cut optimism
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) closed on a mixed note today, reflecting an overall optimistic market outlook, as investor sentiment remained positive following the interest rate cut announced yesterday. The momentum continued into today’s session, with market participants showing renewed confidence in response to the Central Bank’s supportive monetary policy stance.

title: Trump threatens a 50% tariff on the EU
byline: President Donald Trump on Friday threatened a 50% tariff on goods from the European Union, citing a lack of progress in current trade negotiations.

title: Opposition MPs call for probe into Leader of the House
byline: A group of opposition MPs is set to request Speaker Jagath Wickramaratne to conduct a probe into Leader of the House Bimal Ratnayake, whom they accuse of acting in an undemocratic manner during parliamentary sessions.

title: University of Colombo gets new Vice Chancellor
byline: President Anura Kumara Disanayake has appointed Professor I.M. Karunathilake as the new Vice Chancellor of the University of Colombo.

title: President to embark on official visit to Germany
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake is scheduled to undertake an official visit to Germany commencing on June 10.
